name: Brian Slate
title: Director of Software Engineering
summary: As a Director of Software Engineering, I've found that failing fast is the cheat code to unlocking creativity. I've turned setbacks into successes, pitfalls into platforms, and mistakes into masterstrokes
additionalInfo: Skilled in clear and effective communication
Described by my peers as 'affable and gregarious'
Don't just call me a plant dad, my yard is a lush oasis
Enthusiastic collector of fun and funky timepieces
A fan of graphic novels, especially the eerie worlds of Junji Ito
A devotee of sci-fi and fantasy in all forms
My living space is a curated blend of art and functional pieces

subitems: Crafting Meaningful KPIs for Real Impact

skills.name: DevOps / Platform Engineering
subitems: Github tooling for Testing & Static Analysis

responsibilities: Championed a culture of excellence, leading by example to embed best practices across our technology spectrum — coding, infrastructure, documentation — enhancing team collaboration and conduct.
Excelled in diverse roles — Scrum Master, Engineering Manager, Software Developer, and DevOps/Platform Engineer — demonstrating flexibility and expertise across the development lifecycle.
Successfully integrated agile methodologies into our core development practices, optimizing workflows and project delivery.
Managed and dynamically adapted a team of 10+ members, overseeing hiring, onboarding, and training of developers and contractors, while fostering an environment for career growth.
Streamlined team processes including onboarding, daily scrum meetings, development, code review, and QA & testing, significantly improving efficiency and team performance.
Led the modernization and scaling of a monolithic PHP & React application, enhancing performance and scalability.
Architected and developed a CI/CD platform from the ground up, automating previously manual processes and significantly reducing deployment errors and increasing deployment cadence.
Enhanced local application development consistency and deployment by adopting Docker and leveraging ECS Fargate.
Migrated an aging Angular.js SPA to Angular using event-driven observable architecture
Implemented a cross-team tool for managing iframed applications, empowering multi-faceted development teams to build/deploy autonomously
Built and maintained our centralized 'Admin UI' portal to provide dynamic configuration for all other company micro-services
Showcased our VR-based support app to 2,000+ attendees at our company keynote, introduced by our CEO
Participated in the transition process during the acquisition of Interactive Intelligence, ensuring a smooth integration of technologies and teams

employment.other-notes: BlueTree Network was acquired by Providence St. Joseph Health in 2019.
responsibilities: Crafted a platform to expertly match healthcare facilities with elite Epic consultants for post-launch software implementation, streamlining the connection process.
Led initial development team as CTO
Acted as a technical bridge between founders and the development team
Transformed a .NET webforms/MVC system into an elegant Ember.js SPA & REST API
Assisted in white-labeling BlueTree's software platform for other organizations, such as United Way.

employment.company: University of Wisconsin Department of Medicine
responsibilities: Built several research database systems for the UW Atherosclerosis Imaging Research Program
Created a comprehensive HR management portal using Ruby on Rails & SQL Server
Migrated and developed two public-facing departmental websites using Drupal
Developed an in-house 'Query Manager' tool allowing researcher self-service access to warehoused data
Built tools to quickly scaffold applications to meet department needs
